channel.title: Webclient help!
channel.description:
I am working on two new projects called RuneScape 3 and HellzPkz. I am trying to make a webclient for each of them. HellzPkz is my friends server, but he don't know how to code, so i'm doing it for him. I am owner of RuneScape 3. I made the client.jar and signed the client and everything and i have a few html codes for the client to run. Here are the codes i have:
<HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE>RuneScape 3 WebClient</TITLE> <META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE"> </HEAD>
<BODY>
<applet name="RuneScape 3" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class"> <param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m"> </applet>
</BODY> </HTML>
And..
<html> <title>RuneScape 3 Webclient</title> <center><applet name="app" width="765" height="503" archive="http://rapidshare.com/files/237813925/client.jar.html" code="client"> </applet></center> </html>
I tried embedding the webclient into my website. And when i tried loading the page, it said "loading applet.." then 'applet not found"
My website is located at RuneScape3.at.ua and the webclient link is http://runescape3.at.ua/index/0-9
If you can help me resolve this, I am willing to give co-ownership on the server, and credits.

item.title: Webclient help!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

Well I used fileden for the cache, but all the tutorials says I need the files uploaded on my site. And I got the client.jar uploaded at runescape3.at.ua/client.jar, and i tried the code

RuneScape 3 Webclient

but it didn’t help any. The webclient box popped up, and said java, then it said error. I don’t know if the html code is wrong or if i uploaded it wrong. So if someone could post a topic on how to upload each file, cache, client.jar, and html code, and where to upload them, and then how to fix the webclient, I would very much appreciate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

www.fileden.com

Only 5GB bandwidth a month so if your sever is very popular it wont be useful unless you mirror the cache with multiple accounts.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help!
item.dc:creator: @GrimReapersScythe GrimReapersScythe
item.description:
@GrimReapersScythe wrote:

When i try to upload the client.jar, the cache, or the html code, directly to the site it won’t upload because the file size is too big. I also tried using ftp clients to upload them, and it will upload and when it gets to about 90% of uploading it starts over, and doesn’t completely upload the file. If anyone can help me I would really much appreciate it.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient help!
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

http://rapidshare.com/files/237813925/client.jar.html

That is not the right way to do it, you need to upload it to your site directory, like:http://runescape3.at.au/client.jar

Read full topic
